definition: Data involving 2 variables. One value of one variable is paired with another value of another variable.
Referred to as r squared, this is the proportion of the variance between two variables.
Answers how strong a linear relationship is.
Also called the response variable, this responds to the independent variable. This is the output.
Also called the explanatory variable or predictor variable, this is the x
Referred to as r, this is a measure of the strength and direction of the linear relation between two quantitative variables.
Answers if there is a relationship between 2 variables.
The difference between the actual values and the estimated values.
Measures how far the data is spread out (the average squared distance from the mean).
